Title.En: Technology and Innovation in Business Sustainability

Description.En:
Companies can build competitive advantages and resilience by developing more sustainable business models (e.g. the sharing economy) and using new technologies (e.g. internet of things or AI).

We will have an overview of what sustainability in business means and entails, analyse and debate more in depth a couple of sectors, and work in groups to explore business opportunities in sustainability.

The course will have In this 6 modules and a short individual post assignment:

- Introduction: sustainability in business
- Analysis of an example sector (1): mobility
- Regulation, technology and the responsible consumer
- Analysis of an example sector (2): health
- Team work:
- Choose and analyse sector
- Groups presentations:
- Identify and describe a sustainable startup business opportunity
- driven by technology
- Post assignment: individual work

PrefLabel.En: minimise environmental impact on the surrounding area

NoteLiteral.En: A company's strategy and actions to reduce adverse environmental and social impacts.
Creating, modifying, or defining the fundamental structure and components of a business model to create new value propositions, capture new market opportunities, and gain a competitive advantage.

Title.En: Technology and Innovation in Business Sustainability
Technology and Innovation in Business Sustainability

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The idea that a business becoming more responsible and sustainable might result into lower profits is quickly becoming obsolete.

This course will show students how both new and established companies can develop innovative business models and use new technologies to build competitive advantages, as they become more sustainable, resilient and ultimately, successful.

**To apply, please upload:**

- your CV in English;
- if available, the English language certification
- a brief motivational letter (1.000 characters) OR a motivational video (max 40’’, preferably youtube link) where you explain WHY you are interested in THIS learning opportunity.
- Transcript of records

Please identify your Applicant status:

1-UniTrento PhD or Student

 2-ECIU student

 3-Erasmus+ or Bilateral agreement student (in Trento for the whole semester)

4-Student enrolled in Erasmus+ (non ECIU) partner University, applying for a challenge or BIP-Blended Intensive Program in Trento

5-Other (extra fees may apply)

Status 1, 2 and 3 applicants need to submit two applications (similar documents, same deadline on 25 September):

[SOI Admission Apply](https://webapps.unitn.it/Apply/it/MyUnitn/Home/334102/serv-studenti/Sel_SoI_2024_1)

[ECIU Admission application](https://engage.eciu.eu/browse?universityIds=c7bc8551-6a54-ed11-bba2-6045bd886566&learningOppStatuses=1)

Status 4 and 5 applicants only submit their application in the [SOI Admission Apply](https://webapps.unitn.it/Apply/it/MyUnitn/Home/334102/serv-studenti/Sel_SoI_2024_1)

[Here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1p_7yzGdwBz1VL5Tq86o03TM7zG47B7yT/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=117641408050668552988&rtpof=true&sd=true) you can find guidelines on the application process.
